body_html:
maybe I am misunderstanding "you explicitly agree on what the type should be" ? with torch.Tensor(numpy_array) ?
…
________________________________ From: Adam Paszke <notifications@github.com> Sent: Thursday, October 26, 2017 12:31:46 PM To: pytorch/pytorch Cc: Arthur Szlam; Mention Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] Tensor constructor passed numpy ndarray does not check type. (#3293) No, I can't see why would we need to make it this way. torch.from_numpy has no choice other than raising an error, because there is no corresponding type in torch, so it would violate the contract. However, when you use a tensor constructor, you explicitly agree on what the type should be, so casting the array to whatever is needed is a reasonable decision — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#3293 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AF1_-ejy3frN_4YU1DOWdX-dynmFJNq1ks5swLPygaJpZM4QGvjN>.
body_text:
maybe I am misunderstanding "you explicitly agree on what the type should be" ?   with torch.Tensor(numpy_array) ?
…
________________________________
From: Adam Paszke <notifications@github.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 26, 2017 12:31:46 PM
To: pytorch/pytorch
Cc: Arthur Szlam; Mention
Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] Tensor constructor passed numpy ndarray does not check type. (#3293)


No, I can't see why would we need to make it this way. torch.from_numpy has no choice other than raising an error, because there is no corresponding type in torch, so it would violate the contract. However, when you use a tensor constructor, you explicitly agree on what the type should be, so casting the array to whatever is needed is a reasonable decision

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#3293 (comment)>, or mute the thread<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AF1_-ejy3frN_4YU1DOWdX-dynmFJNq1ks5swLPygaJpZM4QGvjN>.
body:
maybe I am misunderstanding "you explicitly agree on what the type should be" ?   with torch.Tensor(numpy_array) ?

________________________________
From: Adam Paszke <notifications@github.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 26, 2017 12:31:46 PM
To: pytorch/pytorch
Cc: Arthur Szlam; Mention
Subject: Re: [pytorch/pytorch] Tensor constructor passed numpy ndarray does not check type. (#3293)


No, I can't see why would we need to make it this way. torch.from_numpy has no choice other than raising an error, because there is no corresponding type in torch, so it would violate the contract. However, when you use a tensor constructor, you explicitly agree on what the type should be, so casting the array to whatever is needed is a reasonable decision

—
You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
